intro: Jasione jankae, commonly known as the Jankae's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to violet, bloom in late summer and are clustered in racemes. Jasione jankae is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
